item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. How much memory do you need in 2024 to run 1M concurrent tasks? (142 points | 91 comments)
2. Send someone you appreciate an official 'Continue and Persist' Letter (586 points | 112 comments)
3. BYD launches sodium-ion grid-scale BESS product (59 points | 39 comments)
4. The UX of Lego Interface Panels (2020) (299 points | 27 comments)
5. Show HN: Screen Sharing in the Browser (74 points | 9 comments)
6. Australian Parliament bans social media for under-16s (68 points | 90 comments)
7. Engineers do not get to make startup mistakes when they build ledgers (113 points | 110 comments)
8. The trouble with struct sockaddr's fake flexible array (21 points | 1 comment)
9. Microbenchmarks Are Experiments (32 points | 5 comments)
10. The success and failure of Ninja (2020) (170 points | 33 comments)
11. Show HN: Vince – A self hosted alternative to Google Analytics (19 points | 5 comments)
12. Multimodal Interpretability in 2024 (13 points | discuss)
13. A pretty visualisation of the European power grid (2022) (226 points | 111 comments)
14. US antitrust watchdog launches broad Microsoft investigation (27 points | 6 comments)
15. Tk9.0: CGo-free, cross platform GUI toolkit for Go (187 points | 69 comments)
16. William James and the philosophy of pragmatism (2018) (48 points | 6 comments)
17. Borgo Programming Language (4 points | 1 comment)
18. Rapid colonization of a space-returned Ryugu sample by terrestrial microorganism (74 points | 27 comments)
19. An Intuitive Explanation of Sparse Autoencoders for LLM Interpretability (28 points | discuss)
20. Show HN: Indentation-based syntax for Clojure (26 points | 3 comments)
21. Bootkitty: Analyzing the first UEFI bootkit for Linux (119 points | 50 comments)
22. Mechanical Engineer creates instruments for his one man industrial metal band (30 points | 10 comments)
23. A new start after 60: I became a 'hummingbird' for people with dementia (102 points | 13 comments)
24. Aftershock II (23 points | 2 comments)
25. Canada Competition Bureau sues Google for anti-competitive conduct in online ads (55 points | 17 comments)
26. In the Rockets' Red Glare: The past and future of hot-rodding in America (47 points | 41 comments)
27. Float Self-Tagging (36 points | 42 comments)
28. QwQ: Alibaba's O1-like reasoning LLM (337 points | 242 comments)
29. Hetzner cuts traffic on US VPSs, raises prices (313 points | 535 comments)
30. London's 850-year-old food markets to close (280 points | 229 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
